observation: [{'url': 'https://magefan.com/blog/magento-2-product-alerts', 'content': 'Configure Magento Product Alerts Run Settings. To manage the product alerts run settings in Magento 2, take the following steps: 1. Go to Stores > Configuration > Catalog > Catalog and unfold the Product Alerts Run Settings section. 2. Set the Frequency you want the Magento 2 product alerts to be sent with. 3.'}, {'url': 'https://amasty.com/knowledge-base/how-to-set-up-stock-alerts-in-magento-2.html', 'content': 'This setting allows you Magento 2 out of stock products to stay still showing. If Magento display out of stock products not working, then recheck that all the steps are done correctly. Extended options. Stock subscriptions can be a helpful tool for demand analysis and the purchase process management.'}, {'url': 'https://www.magedelight.com/resources/how-to-enable-stock-alert-in-magento-2/', 'content': 'Step #1 - Enable Out of Stock Products Display on Front-end. First of all, we will have to enable the display for out of stock products on the front-end of your Magento 2 store. For this, login to your admin panel and navigate to Stores > Configuration > Catalog > Inventory. After that, Look for the "Stock Options" section on the ...'}, {'url': 'https://blog.magezon.com/how-to-manage-magento-2-inventory-and-stock-mgt/', 'content': 'In the left panel, scroll down to Catalog. Expand Catalog and choose Inventory. And the Inventory Configuration page shows up with the following sections as below: How to manage inventory and stock in Magento (for the whole product) Keep in mind we only focus on two first sections as the main ones, namely: Stock Options.'}, {'url': 'https://aheadworks.com/blog/magento-2-stock-inventory-tutorial', 'content': 'To access the Advanced Inventory Settings, go to the Products menu in your Magento 2 Admin Panel. Here, you should open Catalog in the Inventory section. In Catalog, choose the product to be configured and click on the Edit button. On the window opened, find the Quantity option among all settings and click on the Advanced Inventory button below.. Note that Magento 2 has two advanced settings ...'}]
